before.name: cusi_signal
before.comment: A table that represents a distinct signal-value pair. A signal is used to determine that an account may need investigation and the value is used to group users with the same value. Used by the the Suggested investigations feature of the CheckUser extension.

columns.name: sis_sic_id
columns.comment: Foreign key to the cusi_case row. Used in the composite primary key.

columns.name: sis_name
columns.comment: The name of the signal. Used in the composite primary key.

columns.name: sis_value
columns.comment: The value associated with the signal. Used in the composite primary key.

indexes.name: sis_sic_id
indexes.comment: Used to find cusi_signal rows for a given cusi_case row, when displaying cusi_case rows in the UI.

after.name: cusi_signal
after.comment: A table that represents a distinct signal-value pair. A signal is used to determine that an account may need investigation and the value is used to group users with the same value. Used by the the Suggested investigations feature of the CheckUser extension.

columns.name: sis_sic_id
columns.comment: Foreign key to the cusi_case row. Used in the composite primary key.

columns.name: sis_name
columns.comment: The name of the signal. Used in the composite primary key.

columns.name: sis_value
columns.comment: The value associated with the signal. Used in the composite primary key.

columns.name: sis_trigger_id
columns.comment: The revision or log ID that caused this signal to be evaluated.

columns.name: sis_trigger_type
columns.comment: Integer mapping identifier specifying which table the data in this row relates to. See SuggestedInvestigationsCaseManagerService for the mapping.

indexes.name: sis_sic_id
indexes.comment: Used to find cusi_signal rows for a given cusi_case row, when displaying cusi_case rows in the UI.
